After nine months of Trump's presidency, US inflation returns but does not derail economic policy
byline: By Nicolas Chapuis (New York (United States) correspondent)
subhed: In September, prices rose by 3% year-on-year, above the 2% target. Wall Street judged that this level would not prevent an interest rate cut and responded with a rally. However, inflationary pressures could continue to be fueled by tariffs.

title: US sends aircraft carrier to Latin America as military campaign escalates against alleged drug trafficking
subhed: Trump said Thursday he did not need a declaration of war from US lawmakers to attack Venezuela or other countries he accuses of involvement in the drug trade, warning that strikes on land are coming. Starting in early September, the US has been targeting vessels, allegedly used to smuggle narcotics, in a series of deadly strikes.

title: The Fondation Cartier unveils its new landmark in central Paris
subhed: The Fondation Cartier for Contemporary Art has moved to Place du Palais-Royal in Paris. Like its previous location on Boulevard Raspail, the new building was designed by architect Jean Nouvel, conceived as an innovative, flexible space that can be configured in countless ways.

title: 'The Louvre's stolen jewels, valuable only for their gemstones, are above all outdated and cumbersome'
subhed: Reactions to the Louvre heist ignore the complex equation museums face: offering generous public access while securing cumbersome objects better suited for a bank vault, explains Le Monde columnist Michel Guerrin.

title: Fighting their own country: Hundreds of thousands of Ukrainians are forcibly conscripted by Russia
subhed: Moscow is pursuing a policy of forced Russification and militarization in occupied territories, aiming to turn the local population into soldiers. These Ukrainians account for one quarter of the prisoners of war held by Kyiv, Le Monde reveals.
